keyword: how many calories in a red apple
title: How Many Calories in a Red Apple?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a red apple, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and quick tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Red Apple?
assumptions: Medium-sized (182 g) raw red apple with skin, no core or seeds included in edible portion.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by apple size, variety, ripeness, and growing conditions. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One medium red apple provides about 95 kcal and 4.4 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one red apple?
faqs.a: About 95 kcal for a medium-sized red apple with skin.

faqs.q: Does a red apple have fiber?
faqs.a: Yes, around 4.4 g of dietary fiber per medium apple, mostly in the skin.

faqs.q: Are red apples low in sugar?
faqs.a: They contain about 18.9 g of natural sugars per medium apple, but also fiber to balance.

faqs.q: How does apple size affect calories?
faqs.a: Small apples have ~65 kcal, large ~116 kcal; medium is the standard ~95 kcal.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a red apple?
faqs.a: Approximately 25.1 g total carbs, with 4.4 g fiber and 18.9 g sugars.
